domains.title: Environmental Domain
domains.description: Material resources and physical surroundings both inside and outside the living area, neighborhood, and broader community.

problems.title: Income
problems.description: Money from wages, pensions, subsidies, interest, dividends, or other sources available for living and health care expenses.

problems.title: Sanitation
problems.description: Environmental cleanliness and precautions against infection and disease.

problems.title: Residence
problems.description: Living area.

problems.title: Neighborhood/workplace safety
problems.description: Freedom from illness, injury, or loss in the community of place or employment.

domains.title: Psychosocial Domain
domains.description: Patterns of behavior, emotion, communication, relationships, and development.

problems.title: Communication with community resources
problems.description: Interaction between the individual/family/community and social service organizations, schools, and businesses in regard to services, information, and goods/supplies.

signsAndSymptoms.title: unfamiliar with options/procedures for obtaining services
difficulty understanding roles/regulations of service providers
unable to communicate concerns to provider
unable to use/has inadequate communication devices/equiptment

problems.title: Social contact
problems.description: Interaction between the individual/family/community and others outside the immediate living area.

signsAndSymptoms.title: uses health care provider for social contact

problems.title: Role change
problems.description: Additions to or removal of a set of expected behavioral characteristics.

problems.title: Interpersonal relationship
problems.description: Associations or bonds between the individual/family/community and others.

problems.title: Spirituality
problems.description: Beliefs and practices that involve faith, religion, values, the spirit, and/or the soul.

signsAndSymptoms.title: conflicting spiritual beliefs and medical/health care regimen

problems.title: Grief
problems.description: Suffering and distress associated with loss.

signsAndSymptoms.title: fails to recognize stages of grief/process of healing
conflicting stages of grief among individuals/families

problems.title: Mental health
problems.description: Development and use of mental/emotional abilities to adjust to life situations, interact with others, and engage in activities

problems.title: Sexuality
problems.description: Attitudes, feelings, and behaviors related to intimacy and sexual activity.

signsAndSymptoms.title: difficulty recognizing consequences of sexual behavior

problems.title: Caretaking/parenting
problems.description: Providing support, nurturance, stimulation, and physical care for dependent child or adult.

signsAndSymptoms.title: difficulty providing cognitive learning experiences and activities
difficulty providing preventive and therapeutic health care
expectations incongruent with stage of growth and development
difficulty interpreting or responding to verbal/nonverbal communication

problems.title: Neglect
problems.description: Child or adult deprived of minimally accepted standards of food, shelter, clothing, or care.

problems.title: Abuse
problems.description: Child or adult subjected to nonaccidental physical, emotional, or sexual violence or injury.

problems.title: Growth & development
problems.description: Progressive physical, emotional, and social maturation along the age continuum from bith to death.

signsAndSymptoms.title: abnormal results of developmental screening tests
abnormal weight/height/head circumference in relation growth/aging standards

domains.title: Physiological Domain
domains.description: Functions and processes that maintain life.

problems.title: Hearing
problems.description: Perception of sound by the ears.

signsAndSymptoms.title: difficulty hearing speech in large group settings
abnormal results of hearing screening test

problems.title: Vision
problems.description: Act or power of sensing with the eyes.

signsAndSymptoms.title: abnormal results of vision screening test

problems.title: Speech & language
problems.description: Use of articulated vocal sounds, symbols, signs, or gestures for communication.

problems.title: Oral health
problems.description: Condition of the mouth and gums and the number, type, and arrangement of the teeth.

problems.title: Cognition
problems.description: Ability to think and use information.

signsAndSymptoms.title: limited recall of long past events

problems.title: Pain
problems.description: Unpleasant sensory and emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage.

problems.title: Consciousness
problems.description: Awareness of and responsiveness to stimuli and the surroundings.

problems.title: Skin
problems.description: Natural covering of the body.

problems.title: Neuro-musculo-skeletal function
problems.description: Ability of nerves, muscles, and bones to perform or coordinate specific movement, sensation, or regulation.

problems.title: Respiration
problems.description: Inhaling and exhaling air into the body and exchanging oxygen.

problems.title: Circulation
problems.description: Pumping blood in adequate amounts and pressure throughout the body.

problems.title: Digestion-hydration
problems.description: Process of converting food into forms that can be absorbed and assimilated, and maintaining fluid balance.

problems.title: Bowel function
problems.description: Transporting food through the gastrointestinal tract to eliminate wastes.

problems.title: Urinary function
problems.description: Production and excretion of urine.

problems.title: Reproductive function
problems.description: Condition of the genital organs and breasts and the ability to reproduce.

signsAndSymptoms.title: abnormal lumps/swelling/tenderness of genital organs or breasts
pain during or after sexual intercourse

problems.title: Pregnancy
problems.description: Period from conception to childbirth.

problems.title: Postpartum
problems.description: Six-week period following childbirth.

problems.title: Communicable/infectious condition
problems.description: State in which organisms invade/infest and produce superficial or systemic illness with the potential for spreading or transmission.

signsAndSymptoms.title: does not follow infection control regimen

domains.title: Health-related Behaviors Domain
domains.description: Patterns of activity that maintain or promote wellness, promote recovery, and decrease the risk of disease.

problems.title: Nutrition
problems.description: Select, consume, and use food and fluids for energy, maintenance, growth, and health.

signsAndSymptoms.title: overweight: adult BMI 25.0 or more; child BMI 95th percentile or more
underweight: adult BMI 18.5 or less; child BMI 5th percentile or less
lacks established standards for daily caloric/fluid intake
exceeds established standards for daily caloric/fluid intake
does not follow recommended nutrition plan

problems.title: Sleep & rest patterns
problems.description: Periods of suspended motor and sensory activity and periods of inactivity, repose, or mental calm.

problems.title: Physical activity
problems.description: State or quality of body movements during daily living.

signsAndSymptoms.title: inappropriate type/amount of exercise for age/physical condition

problems.title: Personal care
problems.description: Management of personal cleanliness and dressing.

signsAndSymptoms.title: unwilling/unable/forgets to complete personal care activities

problems.title: Substance use
problems.description: Consumption of medicines, recreational drugs, or other materials likely to cause mood changes and/or psychological/physical dependence, illness, and disease.

problems.title: Family planning
problems.description: Practices designed to plan and space pregnancy within the context of values, attitudes, and beliefs.

signsAndSymptoms.title: inappropriate/insufficient knowledge about family planning methods
inappropriate/insufficient knowledge about preconception health practices
inaccurate/inconsistent use of family planning methods
dissatisfied with present family planning method
fears others' reactions regarding family planning choices

problems.title: Health care supervision
problems.description: Management of the health care treatment plan by health care providers.

signsAndSymptoms.title: fails to obtain routine/preventive health care
fails to seek care for symptoms requiring evaluation/treatment
fails to return as requested to health care provider
inability to coordinate multiple appointments/treatment plans

problems.title: Medication regimen
problems.description: Use or application of over-the-counter and prescribed/recommended medications and infusions to meet guidelines for therapeutic action, safety, and schedule.

signsAndSymptoms.title: unable to take medications without help

scope.title: Individual
scope.description: A person who lives alone or a single-family member who experiences a health-related problem.

scope.title: Family
scope.description: A social unit or related group of individuals who live together and experience a health-related problem.

scope.title: Community
scope.description: The individuals and/or families who comprise a group, neighborhood, or other geographic district that experience a health-related problem.

severity.title: Health Promotion
severity.description: Client interest in increasing knowledge, behavior, and health expectations and developing more assets and resources that maintain or enhance well-being in the absence of risk factors, signs, or symptoms.

severity.title: Potential
severity.description: Client status characterized by the presence of certain health patterns, practices, behaviors, or risk factors that may preclude optimal health and the absence of signs and symptoms.

severity.title: Actual
severity.description: Client status characterized by one or more existing signs and symptoms that may preclude optimal health.

categories.title: Teaching, Guidance, and Counseling
categories.description: Activities designed to provide information and materials, encourage action and responsibility for self-care and coping, and assist the individual, family, or community to make decisions and solve problems.

categories.title: Treatments and Procedures
categories.description: Technical activities such as wound care, specimen collection, resistive exercises, and medication prescriptions that are designed to prevent, decrease, or alleviate signs and symptoms for the individual, family, or community.

categories.title: Case Management
categories.description: Activities such as coordination, advocacy, and referral that facilitate service delivery, promote assertiveness, guide the individual, family, or community toward use of appropriate resources, and improve communication among health and human service providers.

categories.title: Surveillance
categories.description: Activities such as detection, measurement, critical analysis, and monitoring intended to identify the individual, family, or community's status in relation to a given condition or phenomenon.

targets.title: anatomy/physiology
targets.description: Structure and function of the human body.

targets.title: anger management
targets.description: Activities that decrease or control negative feelings and interactions, including violence.

targets.title: behavior modification
targets.description: Activities that change habits, conduct, or patterns of action.

targets.title: bladder care
targets.description: Activities that promote urinary bladder function such as bladder retraining, catheter changes, and catheter irrigation.

targets.title: bonding/attachment
targets.description: A mutual, positive relationship between two people such as a parent/caregiver and an infant/child.

targets.title: bowel care
targets.description: Activities that promote bowel function such as bowel training and enemas.

targets.title: cardiac care
targets.description: Activities that promote cardiac or circulatory function such as energy conservation and fluid balance.

targets.title: caretaking/parenting skills
targets.description: Activities such as feeding, bathing, discipline, nurturing, and stimulation provided to a dependent child or adult.

targets.title: cast care
targets.description: Activities that promote cleanliness, dryness, support, alignment, and relief of pain, pressure, and constriction of an injured body part immobilized by a cast, splint, or other device.

targets.title: communication
targets.description: Exchange of verbal or nonverbal information between the individual/family/community and others.

targets.title: community outreach worker services
targets.description: Assistance with managing health care, transportation, household, and child/adult care responsibilities provided by qualified employees under the supervision of professional health care providers.

targets.title: continuity of care
targets.description: Communication of information among providers/organizations to provide safe and effective care and decrease duplication of efforts/services.

targets.title: coping skills
targets.description: Ability to effectively manage challenges and changes such as illness, disability, loss of income, birth of a child, or death of a family member.

targets.title: day care/respite
targets.description: Individuals or organizations that provide child/adult supervision while the parent/usual caregiver attends school, works, or has relief from usual responsibilities.

targets.title: dietary management
targets.description: Nourishment with balanced food and fluids that sustain life, provide energy, and promote growth and health.

targets.title: discipline
targets.description: Nurturing practices that promote appropriate behavior, conduct, and self-control.

targets.title: dressing change/wound care
targets.description: Activities that promote wound healing and prevent infection such as observing, measuring, cleansing, irrigating, and/or covering a wound, lesion, or incision.

targets.title: durable medical equipment
targets.description: Nondisposable items used while providing care such as special beds, walkers, and apnea monitors.

targets.title: education
targets.description: Formal programs that offer general, technical, or individualized studies for students of all ages.

targets.title: employment
targets.description: Occupation that provides income.

targets.title: end-of-life care
targets.description: Activities that provide physical comfort and emotional calm for those who are dying by involving/including family, friends, spiritual concerns, rituals, pain control, and physical care.

targets.title: environment
targets.description: Physical surroundings, conditions, or influences in the residence, neighborhood, and/or community

targets.title: exercises
targets.description: Therapeutic physical activities such as active/passive range of motion, isometrics, stretching, and weight lifting.

targets.title: family planning care
targets.description: Activities that support consideration and use of methods to prepare for and space pregnancy.

targets.title: feeding procedures
targets.description: Provision of food or fluids using methods such as breast, formula, spoon, tube, and intravenous solutions.

targets.title: finances
targets.description: Management of income and expenses.

targets.title: gait training
targets.description: Systematic activities that promote walking with or without assistive devices.

targets.title: genetics
targets.description: Diagnosis, consultation, and procedures intended to prevent, identify, or treat birth defects, congenital anomalies, or conditions.

targets.title: growth/development care
targets.description: Activities that promote progressive maturation in relation to age such as measuring weight, height, and head circumference and stimulating achievement of developmental milestones.

targets.title: home
targets.description: Place of residence.

targets.title: homemaking/housekeeping
targets.description: Management of activities such as cleaning, laundry, and food preparation in the home or the health care facility.

targets.title: infection precautions
targets.description: Activities that decrease the incidence and transmission of contagious disease such as hand washing, isolation, specimen collection, contact followup, reporting procedures, and environmental control.

targets.title: interaction
targets.description: Reciprocal action or influence among people including parent-child, parent-teacher, and nurse-client.

targets.title: interpreter/translator services
targets.description: Assistance with verbal or written communication in other languages provided by qualified employees who are under the supervision of professional health care practitioners.

targets.title: laboratory findings
targets.description: Results of fluid and tissue tests such as urine and blood analysis.

targets.title: legal system
targets.description: Authority, rules of conduct, or administration of the law.

targets.title: medical/dental care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by physicians, dentists, and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: medication action/side effects
targets.description: Positive and/or negative consequences of medications.

targets.title: medication administration
targets.description: Activities that involve applying or giving medications and that are completed by clients, parents/caregivers, or health care practitioners.

targets.title: medication coordination/ordering
targets.description: Communication with those who prescribe and dispense medications and the individual/family/community support systems to ensure that appropriate medications and supplies are obtained in a timely manner.

targets.title: medication prescription
targets.description: A formalized pharmaceutical order/official request for medications.

targets.title: medication set-up
targets.description: Act of preparing for medication administration by filling/checking an oral medication organizer, prefilling syringes, or inserting intravenous access devices.

targets.title: mobility/transfers
targets.description: Body movements that change position or allow participation in activities such as walking.

targets.title: nursing care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by nurses and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: nutritionist care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by nutritionists/registered dieticians and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: occupational therapy care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by occupational therapists and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: ostomy care
targets.description: Activities to manage elimination of urine or stool through artificial openings such as a colostomy and ileostomy.

targets.title: other community resources
targets.description: Organizations or groups that offer goods or services not specifically identified in other targets such as exercise facilities, food pantries/distribution centers, or faith communities.

targets.title: paraprofessional/aide care
targets.description: Assistance provided by qualified aides, home health aides, and nursing assistants under the supervision of professional health care practitioners.

targets.title: personal hygiene
targets.description: Individual grooming activities such as bathing, shampooing, and toileting.

targets.title: physical therapy care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by physical therapists and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: positioning
targets.description: Alignment of the body to promote comfort and function.

targets.title: recreational therapy care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by recreational therapists and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: relaxation/breathing techniques
targets.description: Activities that relieve muscle tension, induce a quieting body response, and rebuild energy resources such as deep breathing exercises, guided imagery, meditation, and massage.

targets.title: respiratory care
targets.description: Activities that promote respiratory or pulmonary function such as suctioning and nebulizer treatments.

targets.title: respiratory therapy care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by respiratory therapists and staff or assistants.

targets.title: rest/sleep
targets.description: Periodic state of quiet and varying degrees of consciousness.

targets.title: safety
targets.description: Freedom from risk, the occurrence of injury, or loss.

targets.title: screening procedures
targets.description: Evaluation strategies used to identify risk for conditions, diagnose disease early, and monitor change/progression over time.

targets.title: sickness/injury care
targets.description: Activities in response to illness or accidents such as first aid and temperature taking.

targets.title: signs/symptoms-mental/emotional
targets.description: Objective or subjective evidence of mental/emotional health problems such as depression, confusion, or agitation.

targets.title: signs/symptoms-physical
targets.description: Objective or subjective evidence of physical health problems such as fever, sudden weight loss, or statement of pain.

targets.title: skin care
targets.description: Activities that promote skin integrity such as application of lotion and massage.

targets.title: social work/counseling care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by social workers, counselors, and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: specimen collection
targets.description: Activities designed to obtain samples of human and animal tissue, fluids, secretions, or excreta such as blood, urine, stool, sputum, and drainage.

targets.title: speech and language pathology care
targets.description: Assessment/diagnosis and treatment provided by speech and language pathologists and their staff or assistants.

targets.title: spiritual care
targets.description: Activities that promote personal serenity and comfort and involve spiritual concerns/practices.

targets.title: stimulation/nurturance
targets.description: Activities that promote healthy physical, intellectual, and emotional development.

targets.title: stress management
targets.description: Cognitive, emotional, and physical activities that promote healthy functioning during difficult life circumstances.

targets.title: substance use cessation
targets.description: Activities that promote discontinuing use of harmful/addicting materials.

targets.title: supplies
targets.description: Disposable items used while providing care such as dressings, syringes, tubing, diapers, and baby bottles.

targets.title: support group
targets.description: Organized sources of information and assistance such as focused classes and organizations, telephone reassurance, and reliable Internet sites that address a specific topic such as parenting, alcoholism, obesity, and Alzheimer's disease.

targets.title: support system
targets.description: Circle of family, friends, and associates that provide love, care, and assistance to promote health and manage illness.

targets.title: transportation
targets.description: Methods of travel such as a car, bus, taxi, scooter, or cart.

targets.title: wellness
targets.description: Practices that promote physical and mental health such as exercise, nutrition, and immunizations.

targets.title: other
targets.description: Persons, places, things, or activities not identified in this list.

ratings.title: Status
ratings.description: Condition of the client in relation to objective and subjective defining characteristics.

ratings.title: Knowledge
ratings.description: Ability of the client to remember and interpret information.

ratings.title: Behavior
ratings.description: Observable responses, actions, or activities of the client fitting the occasion or purpose.
